channel.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
channel.description:
I'm thinking on upgrading to Windows 7 and I gotta ask this:
What features does it have? Is it better than vista, or good as I hear?

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:61, topic:287168”]vmware is better imo

  1. lets u boot from physical hdd not just virtual ones[/quote]

Virtualbox allows you to do this as well, using a command like the following:

VBoxManage internalcommands createrawvmdk -filename <Absolute Path to output File> -rawdisk /dev/sda -register

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:65, topic:287168”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=379751.msg2869376#msg2869376 date=1247664255]

Just attempted to install Windows 7 on my rig. It has failed 5 times so far… The setup is honestly the biggest fucking pile of shit I’ve ever seen. Hell, it doesn’t even support FAT32 OR can read disks that PREVIOUSLY had FAT32 MBRs even after ticking the ‘format’ button. So far, I’ve had more trouble with this than any other OS installation.

My install was flawless, seem’s weird that yours is fucking up so badly.

I’m going to remove my SAS controller and see if that changes anything. I think that is the problem. Regardless, the installer is a huge hunk of shit even compared to XP’s (and of course Linux distros).
[/quote]

Ubuntu failed on me when I attemped to install it.[/quote]Cuz ubuntu sucks

Read full topic

I’m going to remove my SAS controller and see if that changes anything. I think that is the problem. Regardless, the installer is a huge hunk of shit even compared to XP’s (and of course Linux distros).[/quote]

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:63, topic:287168”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=379751.msg2870173#msg2870173 date=1247704568]

T4_, I’ve installed win7 on a few computers and not a single problem so far. I honestly think you’re just looking for reasons to bash windows.

No, I just have non-shit hardware. Well, I’ve gotten it to install on regular SATA/300 drives… It’s ok, but I hate the looks/organization/administration of it. So now I am installing Gentoo and going to be gaming using VirtualBox’s new 3D acceleration and multi-CPU features. I’ve talked to various people and they’ve said gaming works like a charm in the virtual environment. Don’t get me wrong, Holic, I love to bash Microsoft and Apple products; but, in this case I was honest.

vmware is better imo

  1. lets u boot from physical hdd not just virtual ones
  2. uses less cpu when virtual machine is idle
    [/quote]
    But I heard it doesn’t have 3D-Accelleration passthrough… Or does it?[/quote]
    vmware had direct3d accel way before virtualbox (i didnt even hear vbox got it til today)

ask Sensored, he plays cnc3 through vmware

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:61, topic:287168”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=379751.msg2870108#msg2870108 date=1247701104]

T4_, I’ve installed win7 on a few computers and not a single problem so far. I honestly think you’re just looking for reasons to bash windows.

No, I just have non-shit hardware. Well, I’ve gotten it to install on regular SATA/300 drives… It’s ok, but I hate the looks/organization/administration of it. So now I am installing Gentoo and going to be gaming using VirtualBox’s new 3D acceleration and multi-CPU features. I’ve talked to various people and they’ve said gaming works like a charm in the virtual environment. Don’t get me wrong, Holic, I love to bash Microsoft and Apple products; but, in this case I was honest.
[/quote]
vmware is better imo

  1. lets u boot from physical hdd not just virtual ones
  2. uses less cpu when virtual machine is idle[/quote]
    But I heard it doesn’t have 3D-Accelleration passthrough… Or does it?

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:62, topic:287168”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=379751.msg2870173#msg2870173 date=1247704568]

T4_, I’ve installed win7 on a few computers and not a single problem so far. I honestly think you’re just looking for reasons to bash windows.

No, I just have non-shit hardware. Well, I’ve gotten it to install on regular SATA/300 drives… It’s ok, but I hate the looks/organization/administration of it. So now I am installing Gentoo and going to be gaming using VirtualBox’s new 3D acceleration and multi-CPU features. I’ve talked to various people and they’ve said gaming works like a charm in the virtual environment. Don’t get me wrong, Holic, I love to bash Microsoft and Apple products; but, in this case I was honest.

vmware is better imo

  1. lets u boot from physical hdd not just virtual ones
  2. uses less cpu when virtual machine is idle
    [/quote]
    For running Games and programs that need lot of the computer you should install Vista/7 direct on the computer and not VMware/VirtualBox.[/quote]
    Sorry, Windows as a host is too much of a pain in the ass. Gentoo is very friendly.

I am installing games into the virtual environment now, I will post here once I’ve tested its handling.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:57, topic:287168”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=379751.msg2868864#msg2868864 date=1247621971]
Just attempted to install Windows 7 on my rig. It has failed 5 times so far… The setup is honestly the biggest fucking pile of shit I’ve ever seen. Hell, it doesn’t even support FAT32 OR can read disks that PREVIOUSLY had FAT32 MBRs even after ticking the ‘format’ button. So far, I’ve had more trouble with this than any other OS installation.
[/quote]

My install was flawless, seem’s weird that yours is fucking up so badly.[/quote]
I’m going to remove my SAS controller and see if that changes anything. I think that is the problem. Regardless, the installer is a huge hunk of shit even compared to XP’s (and of course Linux distros).

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:45, topic:287168”][quote author=Newty link=topic=379751.msg2859130#msg2859130 date=1247063461]

Is it an easy upgrade? And by that I mean, not formatting and starting over for the new OS. Something simple like, boot with CDs, install, wam-bam new OS and everything else is the same.

I just recently got a new computer and laptop (both within the past 5 months) and I think I’ve dealt with enough reinstalling for a while.

It is very easy, just partition a small section of your harddrive and then boot from the CD and it will ask what partition you want it installed on and the rest is automatic.
[/quote]

So if right now all I have is C, I’d partition off ~10GB as D, boot, install it on D. Then what? I can boot either Vista or Windows 7? And if I boot into Windows 7 all my programs are still recognized and etc?[/quote]
No, but you will find them in the D:\programs files\ (On windows 7, C: will be the Windows 7 partion and Vista D:), some programs may not work like Adobe programs and your 3D programs that need serial codes.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:53, topic:287168”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=379751.msg2859252#msg2859252 date=1247068222]

This just in - people work on things before they are released

Yes, but selling OS after OS every two years isn’t exactly right.
[/quote]

Everyone does it though don’t they, Apple does right?

All bugs in vista are already fixed as of SP1.

I wouldn’t go that far with any OS, not even linux.[/quote]Perhaps i misused the words, i was referring to all the bugs people complained about in Vista on release.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

The_Flames:

Well considering the OS isn’t actually out yet (and won’t be until the Autumn, unless I’ve missed something?) so therefore I assume you’re speaking of upgrading to the release candidate in which case I have to say; Why? Its not like you’ll be able to have the operating system for longer than 8 or so months before your PC starts shutting down every two hours (as Microsoft have stated will happen on March 1st next year).

Use the RC now upgrade to cracked before June 1st 2010 and there you have windows 7.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:

xEnt:

instead of just beefing up visuals and adding useless junk to make things look cool, like they did from the XP to vista transition

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:20, topic:287168”]As long as you don’t pay, it’s worth it. Microdicks is working on a new version of winblowz already. 7 is only gonna be out for about a year,[/quote]i doubt that very much. I can see windows 7 staying around for a good 5 years, getting tuneups etc now and then.

Heh even the posibility of adding an ‘expansion pack’ to windows 7, calling it 7.5 or something.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 08, 2009, 02:23:56 pm[/size][hr]I’ve used XP for a long time, skipped vista, didn’t bother. But Windows 7 RTM (final) build release should be all over torrents by july 20th, ill grab me a copy then. Going to use Windows 7 since they have actually spent a lot of time on performance this time, instead of just beefing up visuals and adding useless junk to make things look cool, like they did from the XP to vista transition. Ill go 64bit this time, never been 64bit due to compatibility, however Windows 7 was programmed with 64bit in mind just as much as 32, as 64bit is becoming mainstream.

Along with my new build coming up soon, shits gonna fly

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:19, topic:287168”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=379751.msg2858559#msg2858559 date=1247023541]

Is it an easy upgrade? And by that I mean, not formatting and starting over for the new OS. Something simple like, boot with CDs, install, wam-bam new OS and everything else is the same.

I just recently got a new computer and laptop (both within the past 5 months) and I think I’ve dealt with enough reinstalling for a while.
[/quote]

It is very easy, just partition a small section of your harddrive and then boot from the CD and it will ask what partition you want it installed on and the rest is automatic.[/quote]

So if right now all I have is C, I’d partition off ~10GB as D, boot, install it on D. Then what? I can boot either Vista or Windows 7? And if I boot into Windows 7 all my programs are still recognized and etc?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7 - Worth Upgrading?
item.dc:creator: @The_Flames The_Flames
item.description:
@The_Flames wrote:

Well considering the OS isn’t actually out yet (and won’t be until the Autumn, unless I’ve missed something?) so therefore I assume you’re speaking of upgrading to the release candidate in which case I have to say; Why? Its not like you’ll be able to have the operating system for longer than 8 or so months before your PC starts shutting down every two hours (as Microsoft have stated will happen on March 1st next year).

Go and get Fedora if you want a new OS. Version 11 recently came out and its great tbh, if you’re interested you should read this ;).

Read full topic
